20110121230136.000|20110121230139.000|TR0|horrible message to hear for the families 
20110121230139.000|20110121230141.000|TR0|of those hostages.  U.S. officials say 
20110121230141.000|20110121230144.000|TR0|it's not clear how much influence bin

20110121230209.000|20110121230211.000|TR0|especially considering there are two lives

20110121230214.000|20110121230216.000|TR0|
20110121230216.000|20110121230219.000|TR0|In an audio message broadcast in part on 
20110121230219.000|20110121230221.000|TR0|Al-Jazeera, a speaker claiming to be Osama 
20110121230221.000|20110121230224.000|TR0|bin Laden warns the French government, two 
20110121230224.000|20110121230226.000|TR0|French journalists being held hostage are 
20110121230226.000|20110121230229.000|TR0|in peril because of your actions.
20110121230229.000|20110121230231.000|TR0|

20110121230234.000|20110121230236.000|TR0|translator):  The refusal of your 
20110121230236.000|20110121230239.000|TR0|President Sarkozy to get out of 
20110121230239.000|20110121230241.000|TR0|Afghanistan is the result of his 
20110121230241.000|20110121230244.000|TR0|subservience to the United States.  And 
20110121230244.000|20110121230246.000|TR0|this is considered the green light to kill 
20110121230246.000|20110121230249.000|TR0|your prisoners without delay.       TODD:  
20110121230249.000|20110121230251.000|TR0|U.S. counterterror officials tell CNN 
20110121230251.000|20110121230254.000|TR0|while there's no reason to believe that 
20110121230254.000|20110121230256.000|TR0|isn't bin Laden speaking, it's not clear 
20110121230256.000|20110121230259.000|TR0|how much influence he has over the fate of 
20110121230259.000|20110121230301.000|TR0|the two journalists, who were seized by 
20110121230301.000|20110121230304.000|TR0|the Taliban in 2009.
20110121230304.000|20110121230306.000|TR0|

20110121230309.000|20110121230311.000|TR0|this came last October, and, like this 
20110121230311.000|20110121230314.000|TR0|one, contained a threat against France.
20110121230314.000|20110121230316.000|TR0|

20110121230319.000|20110121230321.000|TR0|while bin Laden singles out France.
20110121230321.000|20110121230324.000|TR0|
20110121230324.000|20110121230326.000|TR0|BRIAN FISHMAN, NEW AMERICA FOUNDATION:  
20110121230326.000|20110121230329.000|TR0|What I think bin Laden sees is that France 
20110121230329.000|20110121230331.000|TR0|may be the weak link.  In Afghanistan, 80 
20110121230331.000|20110121230334.000|TR0|percent of the French population opposes 
20110121230334.000|20110121230336.000|TR0|the war in Afghanistan.  And he thinks 
20110121230336.000|20110121230339.000|TR0|that he can apply some pressure on the 
20110121230339.000|20110121230341.000|TR0|French population and perhaps get them to 
20110121230341.000|20110121230344.000|TR0|pull out.

20110121230406.000|20110121230408.000|TR0|committed to the fight.
20110121230408.000|20110121230411.000|TR0|

20110121230413.000|20110121230416.000|TR0|bin Laden is still hiding out somewhere 
20110121230416.000|20110121230418.000|TR0|along the border between Afghanistan and

20110121230511.000|20110121230513.000|TR0|young jihadists like Anwar al-Awlaki, the

20110121230601.000|20110121230603.000|TR0|that's because al Qaeda still has more of

20110121230818.000|20110121230820.000|TR0|

20110121230823.000|20110121230825.000|TR0|of these audiotapes, there's always a

20110121230835.000|20110121230838.000|TR0|
20110121230838.000|20110121230840.000|TR0|BERGEN:  No.  I think these, they're very 
20110121230840.000|20110121230843.000|TR0|unhidden messages. Kill Westerners, kill 
20110121230843.000|20110121230845.000|TR0|Americans, kill Jews is often the message, 
20110121230845.000|20110121230848.000|TR0|and then sometimes very specific.
20110121230848.000|20110121230850.000|TR0|
20110121230850.000|20110121230853.000|TR0|So the fact that he's talking about France 
20110121230853.000|20110121230855.000|TR0|a lot suggests to me that there was a 
20110121230855.000|20110121230858.000|TR0|terror alert in France in the fall of last 
20110121230858.000|20110121230900.000|TR0|year. There will be some people who will 
20110121230900.000|20110121230903.000|TR0|respond to it.  But it's not a covert 
20110121230903.000|20110121230905.000|TR0|message.  It's an overt message.
20110121230905.000|20110121230908.000|TR0|

20110121230910.000|20110121230913.000|TR0|al-Awlaki, the American- born cleric who 
20110121230913.000|20110121230915.000|TR0|is hiding in Yemen someplace.  Who has 
20110121230915.000|20110121230918.000|TR0|more influence among these people in the 
20110121230918.000|20110121230920.000|TR0|terror world?       BERGEN:  Well, Awlaki 
20110121230920.000|20110121230923.000|TR0|has influence in the English-speaking 
20110121230923.000|20110121230925.000|TR0|world because he's addressing them in 
20110121230925.000|20110121230928.000|TR0|English.  And that's the big difference.
20110121230928.000|20110121230930.000|TR0|
20110121230930.000|20110121230933.000|TR0|And so whether it's Major Nidal Hasan at 
20110121230933.000|20110121230935.000|TR0|Fort Hood, who was consulting with Awlaki 
20110121230935.000|20110121230938.000|TR0|over the Internet, you know, Awlaki does 
20110121230938.000|20110121230940.000|TR0|have some influence.  But bin Laden at the 
20110121230940.000|20110121230943.000|TR0|end of the day is the leader of the global 
20110121230943.000|20110121230945.000|TR0|jihad movement.  And in the 
20110121230945.000|20110121230948.000|TR0|Arabic-speaking world, I mean, that's 
20110121230948.000|20110121230950.000|TR0|where -- Awlaki is not communicating with 
20110121230950.000|20110121230953.000|TR0|the Arabic-speaking world.
20110121230953.000|20110121230955.000|TR0|

20110121230958.000|20110121231000.000|TR0|the bigger threat right now?

20110121231005.000|20110121231008.000|TR0|of the global jihad movement.  He's the

20110121231050.000|20110121231053.000|TR0|

20110121231055.000|20110121231058.000|TR0|Afghanistan in December talking to some 
20110121231058.000|20110121231100.000|TR0|people who are focused on the bin Laden 
20110121231100.000|20110121231103.000|TR0|issue.  A senior official told me that 
20110121231103.000|20110121231105.000|TR0|they had not had information that they 
20110121231105.000|20110121231108.000|TR0|regarded as reliable on bin Laden for 
20110121231108.000|20110121231110.000|TR0|years.  They have a hypothesis that he is 
20110121231110.000|20110121231113.000|TR0|in the Northwest Frontier region of 
20110121231113.000|20110121231115.000|TR0|Pakistan.  That's like saying I think that 
20110121231115.000|20110121231118.000|TR0|somebody is in Virginia.  It's not a very 
20110121231118.000|20110121231120.000|TR0|good clue.
20110121231120.000|20110121231122.000|TR0|
20110121231122.000|20110121231125.000|TR0|BLITZER:  But it raises the question, how 
20110121231125.000|20110121231127.000|TR0|is that possible?
20110121231127.000|20110121231130.000|TR0|
20110121231130.000|20110121231132.000|TR0|BERGEN:  It's a very good question, 
20110121231132.000|20110121231135.000|TR0|because we spent half a trillion dollars

20110121235120.000|20110121235122.000|TR0|with details on what happened -- Jeanne.
20110121235122.000|20110121235125.000|TR0|
20110121235125.000|20110121235127.000|TR0|JEANNE MESERVE, CNN HOMELAND SECURITY 
20110121235127.000|20110121235130.000|TR0|CORRESPONDENT:  Wolf, every so often, a 
20110121235130.000|20110121235132.000|TR0|stolen piece of art is recovered and 
20110121235132.000|20110121235135.000|TR0|returned to its rightful owner, and today, 
20110121235135.000|20110121235137.000|TR0|was one of those days.
20110121235137.000|20110121235140.000|TR0|
20110121235140.000|20110121235142.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)
20110121235142.000|20110121235145.000|TR0|
20110121235145.000|20110121235147.000|TR0|MESERVE (voice-over):  Ever so carefully 
20110121235147.000|20110121235150.000|TR0|the tape is cut, the box is opened, the 
20110121235150.000|20110121235152.000|TR0|paper removed.  Inside, a tiny, very 
20110121235152.000|20110121235155.000|TR0|valuable painting, a painting with a 
20110121235155.000|20110121235157.000|TR0|story.  Blanchisseuses souffrant des dents 
20110121235157.000|20110121235200.000|TR0|or laundry woman with toothache was 
20110121235200.000|20110121235202.000|TR0|painted between 1870 and 1872 by Edgar 
20110121235202.000|20110121235205.000|TR0|Degas, one of the giants of the 
20110121235205.000|20110121235207.000|TR0|impressionist movement.  Most famous for 
20110121235207.000|20110121235210.000|TR0|his depictions of dancers.
20110121235210.000|20110121235212.000|TR0|
20110121235212.000|20110121235215.000|TR0|In World War II during intense fighting in 
20110121235215.000|20110121235217.000|TR0|Normandy, an art museum in Lahab (ph) was 
20110121235217.000|20110121235220.000|TR0|destroyed.  When it was rebuilt after the 
20110121235220.000|20110121235222.000|TR0|war, the Louvre in Paris marked the 
20110121235222.000|20110121235224.000|TR0|occasion by lending a painting from its 
20110121235224.000|20110121235227.000|TR0|collection, Blanchisseuses souffrant des 
20110121235227.000|20110121235229.000|TR0|dents.  But, in 1973, it was stolen.  
20110121235229.000|20110121235232.000|TR0|Then, last October, 37 years after its 
20110121235232.000|20110121235234.000|TR0|disappearance, the painting was spotted in 
20110121235234.000|20110121235237.000|TR0|a catalog for the auction house Sotheby's. 
20110121235237.000|20110121235239.000|TR0| It's estimated value, $350,000 to 
20110121235239.000|20110121235242.000|TR0|$450,000.
20110121235242.000|20110121235244.000|TR0|
20110121235244.000|20110121235247.000|TR0|JOHN MORTON, IMMIGRATION  &  CUSTOMS 
20110121235247.000|20110121235249.000|TR0|ENFORCEMENT:  Art person in France noticed 
20110121235249.000|20110121235252.000|TR0|that the painting was being sold, and 
20110121235252.000|20110121235254.000|TR0|Sotheby's called Interpol.  Interpol 
20110121235254.000|20110121235257.000|TR0|called ICE, and we immediately approached 
20110121235257.000|20110121235259.000|TR0|Sotheby's.
20110121235259.000|20110121235302.000|TR0|
20110121235302.000|20110121235304.000|TR0|MESERVE:  These partially obscured numbers 
20110121235304.000|20110121235307.000|TR0|on the back of the painting are inventory 
20110121235307.000|20110121235309.000|TR0|numbers from the Louvre.  They helped 
20110121235309.000|20110121235312.000|TR0|investigators from Immigration and Customs 
20110121235312.000|20110121235314.000|TR0|Enforcement proved that this was, indeed, 
20110121235314.000|20110121235317.000|TR0|the stolen art work.  This week, paperwork 
20110121235317.000|20110121235319.000|TR0|was signed officially returning the 
20110121235319.000|20110121235322.000|TR0|painting to the government of France.
20110121235322.000|20110121235324.000|TR0|

20110121235624.000|20110121235626.000|TR0|REZA SAYAH, CNN INTERNATIONAL 
20110121235626.000|20110121235629.000|TR0|CORRESPONDENT: It's a little after 8:00 in 
20110121235629.000|20110121235631.000|TR0|the morning, and we're in the town of Daud 
20110121235631.000|20110121235634.000|TR0|Khel here in Northwest Pakistan.  We drove 
20110121235634.000|20110121235636.000|TR0|four hours to get here from Islamabad. 
20110121235636.000|20110121235639.000|TR0|This is Islamabad, this is where we are,

20110121235641.000|20110121235644.000|TR0|Taliban activity you hear about is here in 
20110121235644.000|20110121235646.000|TR0|the tribal region, just west of us. And 
20110121235646.000|20110121235649.000|TR0|this is Afghanistan.
20110121235649.000|20110121235651.000|TR0|
20110121235651.000|20110121235654.000|TR0|SAYAH (voice-over): We came here to tell 
20110121235654.000|20110121235656.000|TR0|you the story of Rukhsana Batul (ph).  
20110121235656.000|20110121235659.000|TR0|She's a 25-year-old mother, and every 
20110121235659.000|20110121235701.000|TR0|morning she wakes up, puts on her burka, a 
20110121235701.000|20110121235704.000|TR0|full-length Islamic veil, and takes her 
20110121235704.000|20110121235706.000|TR0|two little boys to school.  That's not so 
20110121235706.000|20110121235709.000|TR0|unusual. What happens next is.  Rukhsana 
20110121235709.000|20110121235711.000|TR0|doesn't leave her kids at school.  
20110121235711.000|20110121235714.000|TR0|Instead, she sits right next to them in 
20110121235714.000|20110121235716.000|TR0|class and learns.  That's because she's 
20110121235716.000|20110121235719.000|TR0|enrolled in first grade with her kids.
20110121235719.000|20110121235721.000|TR0|
20110121235721.000|20110121235724.000|TR0|UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE:  I used to bring my 
20110121235724.000|20110121235726.000|TR0|children to school, and I saw them 
20110121235726.000|20110121235729.000|TR0|studying, and I thought, I really want to 
20110121235729.000|20110121235731.000|TR0|study and learn, too.
20110121235731.000|20110121235734.000|TR0|
20110121235734.000|20110121235736.000|TR0|SAYAH (voice-over): A teacher here at the 
20110121235736.000|20110121235739.000|TR0|school says for weeks, Rukhsana came to 
20110121235739.000|20110121235741.000|TR0|class because her kids wouldn't sit still. 
20110121235741.000|20110121235744.000|TR0| She ended up liking it.  Her parents had 
20110121235744.000|20110121235746.000|TR0|never sent her to school, so the teacher 
20110121235746.000|20110121235749.000|TR0|had an idea, why not enroll and come to 
20110121235749.000|20110121235751.000|TR0|class?  And for Rukhsana, the decision was 
20110121235751.000|20110121235754.000|TR0|easy.
20110121235754.000|20110121235756.000|TR0|

20110121235759.000|20110121235801.000|TR0|interested in studying, and I welcomed

20110121235814.000|20110121235816.000|TR0|Pakistan.  Where we are, it's rare for
